description: From Middle French inflammable, from Medieval Latin īnflammābilis, from Latin īnflammāre (“to set on fire”), from in (“in, on”) + flamma (“flame”).  Equivalent to inflame +‎ -able.

adjectives.description: inflammable (comparative more inflammable, superlative most inflammable)

entries.meaning: Capable of burning; easily set on fire.
examples: Antonyms: fireproof, incombustible, nonflammable, noninflammable, unflammable, uninflammable

entries.meaning: (figuratively) Easily excited; set off by the slightest excuse; easily enraged or inflamed.
(nonstandard) Incapable of burning; not easily set on fire.
examples: Synonyms: fireproof, incombustible, nonflammable, noninflammable, unflammable, uninflammable
